9.0: Seven days (leshiv’as yamim). The numerical value of this phrase is equal to that of “the days of mourning for Mesushelach” (liymei eivel Mesushelach).

46.0: I placed (asim) a nose ring. The word asim is written defective (i.e. missing a yud) to indicate that he did not actually touch her face or even her hand.

10.0: Lest you become impoverished. Leaving the Holy Land was preferable to becoming impoverished in his Torah knowledge through the vicissitudes of famine.

0.0: In the end of days. See Rashi. When the Divine Presence departed he was concerned that his sons were tainted with sin, but they pointed out that the root letters of the word cheit — “sin” — do not even appear in their names. He replied that neither do the letters comprising keitz — “the end [of days]”.
